titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Robert F. Turner Papers, 1958-1975

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-15T12:31-0800

change.item: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Robert F. Turner Papers)//EN" "turnerf.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated

physdesc.extent: 52 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 card file box, 17 envelopes, 1 album box, 1 phonotape cassette, 1 phonorecord

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, reports, speeches, press releases, clippings, printed matter, sound recordings, photographs, and memorabilia, relating to political, social and cultural conditions in Vietnam and to the Vietnamese War

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert F. Turner Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1974.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

item.expan: Army of the Republic of Vietnam
Central Office for South Vietnam. Communist Command of the Forces in South Vietnam
Joint U.S. Public Affairs Office, Saigon
founded in 1960 (to struggle in order to oppose the RVN administration and the U.S., and to progress toward neutrality and reunification with the North)
Peoples Army of the Republic of Vietnam
Contraction of Nguyen Dan Tiet, meaning Festival of the first day of the year. Chinese in origin, the holiday symbolizes the beginning of the Oriental New Year (Lunar New Year)
1. The Central Office of South Vietnam
3. The National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam
Victory in Vietnam Association; a nationwide student organization, since 1967 in Los Angeles, and supporting our government and our military
Vietnam Quoc Dan Dang (Vietnam Nationalist Party)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscript of a projected book on Vietnamese communism, by R. F. Turner as well as published and unpublished articles, speeches, and reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, memoranda, articles transcripts of interviews, notes, pamphlets, clippings, and printed matter relating to Vietnam; collected by R. F. Turner, and arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Manuscript to a projected book on Vietnamese communism, by R. F. Turner.
Agriculture in the Democratic Republic of Vietnam (DRV) (North Vietnam)
Alliance of National Democratic and Peace Forces
Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN)
Regional and Popular Forces in South Vietnam (RF & PF).
Asian opinion on United States involvement in Cambodia
Center for Vietnamese Studies (Southern Illinois University)
Citizens Committee for Peace With Freedom in Vietnam
Cost of Vietnam War to U.S.
VC position on and response to
Honey, P. J., miscellaneous articles on DRV
Index on North Vietnam (Intelligence Subject Code Extract)
International Commission for Supervision and Control in Vietnam (I.C.C.) Report,
Hoang Minh Tan and Nguyen Duy Hung
Nguyen Duy Hung, see Hoang Minh Tan
Nguyen Luong Nhon (aka Viet Hung; aka Tu Tung)
Interviews and conversations in Tan An, miscellaneous Joint U.S. Public Affairs Office, Saigon (JUSPAO)
Land reform, DRV, Bloodbath Controversy (Porter, Chi, etc.)
Law in South Vietnam, legal system, constitution, etc.
Legality of U.S. involvement in Cambodia
Letters (selected) written by defected Vietnamese soldiers,
Logistics, NVN File (and Ho Chi Minh Trail)
Moral case for U.S. involvement in Cambodia
National Student Committee for Victory in Vietnam
North Vietnamese Army, role in South Vietnam
Phoenix Program against Viet Cong Infrastructure (VCI)
POW-MIA (Missing in Action) organization in U.S.
Possible military strategy in case of war
Thompson, Sir Robert, TV interview with
U.S. Mission in Vietnam, press playbacks and releases
U.S. Forces. Psychological Operations (U.S. PSYOPS), Interrogation Report. Source Nguyen-Viet.
Vietnam Alliance of National, Democratic, and Peace Forces
Vietnam Veterans for a Just Peace
Myths of The Vietnam War, The Pentagon Papers Reconsidered,photocopy of typewritten draft of article for Southeast Asian Perspectives.
Vietnam, A Corrective Essay,copy of published article.
Vietnam, A Documented Analysis of The Backgrounds, Issues, and Alternatives,typewritten draft of unpublished book.
Joint United States Public Affairs Office, Saigon, Viet-Nam, Documents and Research Notes; Nos. 1-76,
Joint United States Public Affairs Office, Saigon, Viet-Nam, Documents and Research Notes; Nos. 77-95,
Joint United States Public Affairs Office, Saigon, Viet-Nam, Documents and Research Notes; Nos. 96-98, 101, 103, 106,
Pike, Douglas, Viet Cong Strategy of Terror,
Who's Who In Vietnam, Vietnam Press,
Miscellaneous note cards prepared for research and publication.
10 photos pertaining to the Vietnamese Scouting Program.
13 photos relating to higher education in Vietnam.
10 photos pertaining to agriculture (Five Year Plan) in South Vietnam.
14 photos of the Armed Forces of the Republic of Vietnam, depicting training activities, boats, etc.
21 photos pertaining to public health in Vietnam, depicting training of nurses and health services at hospitals, at the recuperation center of the "Save the Children Fund," dispensaries, etc.
34 very small prints (on 5 filmstrips) of a South Vietnamese village. (17 different photos).
11 photos pertaining to South Vietnam Supreme Court elections.

74 photos (27 in album), 40 negatives (on 5 filmstrips) depicting scenes in "Hue" after the Viet Cong "Tet" - offensive in 1968; also 1 tape cassette with interviews taken near the graveyard in "Hue" on a field trip in 1971.
1 photo depicting a Catholic procession in the liberated area of Ben Tre province (Nam Bo).
1 photo of two youngsters of the communist Dong Nai Regiment (K-3) who defected to the government side.
11 photos of refugees in South Vietnam.
1 photo of R.F. Turner with Vietnamese Children.
6 photos of a farewell party at the joint U.S. Public Affairs Office, Saigon (JUSPAO), depicting Major Joseph J. Heinlein, Deputy Chief for operations, and others.
6 photos of civilian prisoners in North Vietnam and 1 flier published by the National Student Coordinating Committee for Freedom in Vietnam and Southeast Asia.

47 photographs showing various scenes of the National Liberation Front training with automatic weapons, undergoing indoctrination, preparing booby-traps, and posing with personalities. Plus three unidentified photographs of life in South Vietnam.
Interviews taken near the graveyard in 'Hue' on a field trip in 1971
